body.p: This topic contains reusable fragments for the installation topics. The reuse strategy is to ensure that key values can be edited and compared in one place. We reuse in big chunks as reusing highly granular pieces just makes things hard to edit without any real maintainability win. In some cases, content that fits in only one topic is still included here and conrefed into the topic to keep all the information, such as requirements, in one file for ease of editing.

section.p: In this section, the reusable element is the dd element of each dlentry. Where the requirement is the same across platform, there is one entry per requirement that is used in all platforms. Where there are different requirements per platform, the id of the reusable dd element is in the form requirement.platform (for instance, memory.windows).

body.p:
To install a new add-on, follow these steps:
Go to Help Install new add-ons .
In the displayed dialog box, fill-in the Show add-ons from with the update site that hosts add-ons. If you want to see all default add-ons, choose the ALL AVAILABLE SITES option from the Show add-ons from drop down. The add-ons list contains the name, status, update version, version, and the type of the add-on (either framework, or plugin). A short description of each add-on is presented under the add-ons list.To see all the add-ons from the remote update site, deselect Show only compatible add-ons and Show only the latest version of the add-ons. Incompatible add-ons are shown only to acknowledge their presence on the remote update site. You cannot install an incompatible add-on.
By default, only the latest versions of the add-ons that are compatible with the current version of are displayed.
Choose the add-ons you want to install, press the Next button, then follow the on-screen instructions.Accepting the license agreement of the add-on is a mandatory step in the installation process.All add-ons are installed in the extensions directory inside the preferences directory.
